skill.name: chembl-database
skill.description: Query ChEMBL's bioactive molecules and drug discovery data. Search compounds by structure/properties, retrieve bioactivity data (IC50, Ki), find inhibitors, perform SAR studies, for medicinal chemistry.
skill.summary: Query ChEMBL's bioactive molecules and drug discovery data. Search compounds by structure/properties...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill includes Python example scripts that query the ChEMBL database via network API calls. These capabilities are appropriate for the stated research purpose and pose minimal security risk.

low_findings.title: Network queries to ChEMBL API
low_findings.description: The script makes API calls to ChEMBL database using queries like "molecule.get(chembl_id)" and "molecule.filter(pref_name__icontains=name_pattern)". This is expected behavior for a database query skill.

content.value_statement: Finding reliable bioactivity data for drug discovery is time-consuming. This skill queries ChEMBL's curated database of 2M+ compounds and 19M+ bioactivities to deliver targeted results for your research.
actual_capabilities: Search 2M+ bioactive compounds by name, structure, or properties
Retrieve IC50, Ki, and EC50 values for 19M+ bioactivities
Perform similarity and substructure searches using SMILES
Access drug mechanisms and indications data
Export results to pandas DataFrames for analysis
limitations: Depends on ChEMBL API availability and rate limits
Network connection required for all queries
No support for bulk data downloads

use_cases.title: Find potent kinase inhibitors
use_cases.description: Identify compounds with IC50 < 50 nM for EGFR and analyze their molecular properties for lead optimization.

use_cases.title: Build target-compound networks
use_cases.description: Extract bioactivity data for multiple targets and generate interaction networks for systems pharmacology studies.

use_cases.title: Assess competitive landscape
use_cases.description: Review known drugs, mechanisms, and patents for therapeutic targets to inform go/no-go decisions.

best_practices: Always specify activity type and units when querying bioactivities
Use molecular property filters to focus on drug-like compounds
Check data_validity_comment field to identify high-quality measurements
anti_patterns: Downloading entire database without filters or pagination
Assuming all bioactivity values use the same concentration units
Ignoring target_type when searching for specific protein classes

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires Python runtime with chembl_webresource_client installed.

faq.question: Are there query limits?
faq.answer: ChEMBL enforces fair usage policies. Use pagination and caching to avoid rate limits on large queries.

faq.question: Can I export data for analysis?
faq.answer: Yes, the included helper function converts query results to pandas DataFrames for statistical analysis.

faq.question: Is my data secure when using this skill?
faq.answer: The skill only queries public ChEMBL data and does not access local files or credentials.

faq.question: What if my queries timeout?
faq.answer: Reduce query scope, add more filters, or increase the client timeout setting in your Python environment.

faq.question: How does this compare to web searches?
faq.answer: Provides structured, filterable access to curated data with reproducible queries and direct API integration.
